Class DiscreteProbabilityDistribution<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • DiscreteProbabilityDistribution<E>

  • public class DiscreteProbabilityDistribution<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class for drawing random numbers from an arbitrary discrete probability distribution using the alias method. Please see Wikipedia for more details. This is a generic class that is parameterized by the type of outcome that the distribution is meant to represent. For example, the outcome might be a list of torsion angles. This class is immutable.

      Populates the distribution and verifies invariants.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DiscreteProbabilityDistribution

        public DiscreteProbabilityDistribution(java.util.List<E> outcomes,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.Double> probabilites)
        Populates the distribution and verifies invariants. Lists must be the same size and the sum of the probabilities must equal 1.
        Parameters:
        outcomes - possible outcomes
        probabilities - probability of each outcome

        public E getRandom()
        Draws a random outcome based on the given distribution using the alias method.
        Returns:
        E the outcome of the random weighted draw
